discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A : ODatat cause "Must update near real time"

Selected Answer: A
which is the requeriment?
"Must update in near real time"

So I choose A.

It doesn't matter if there are little changes

Same example is given directly in the site: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/integration-overview Refer to the section "Typical scenarios and patterns that use OData integrations". Answer is A only.

Selected Answer: A
A because "must update in near real time"

Selected Answer: B
Data doesnÂ´t change frequently, meaning that near real experience is not needed. Batch Data API is best suitable, configure the batch to run by EOD, once a week or twice a week, depending on the requirements.
A is correct answer

comments.content: A, because the data needs to be updated in D365 in near real time when it does change, so we can't wait for the batch data API to kick in.

discussion.content: B, because data does not change frequently.

questions.question_text:
A company uses an on-premises product management application that manages 200 products. Product information does not change frequently.
You need to synchronize data between the application and Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. Data in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management must update in near real time when changes are made in the application.
What should you recommend?

A local art school is considering a new Dynamics 365 Finance cloud implementation.
The school needs to select a system authentication type.
Which two setup options does the implementation require? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.D: Use a valid Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) account.
choices.E: Use a valid Active Directory account.
choices.B: Use an enabled Dynamics 365 Finance user.

discussion.content: Should be C & D. Can't see the logic of B-Use an enabled D365 Finance user.

Selected Answer: CD
C and D
the answer should be C+D

questions.question_text:
A client wants to create a custom view-only security role that allows users to view the customer list in the accounts receivable module. You create a security role named ReadOnlyUserAR and add the role to users. You create a custom duty named CustomerViewList.
You need to recommend how to implement the privileges.
Which three actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.B: Add the CustCustomerMasterInquire duty to ReadOnlyUserAR.
choices.C: Add the Customers privilege to CustCustomerMasterInquire.
choices.F: Add the Customers privilege to CustomerViewList.
choices.A: Add the Customers privilege to the CustCustomer.

discussion.content: D,E,F is the correct answer.
It has to be D,E,F
FDE should be the sequence

Selected Answer: DEF
D,E,F is correct.
D,E,F is correct

Selected Answer: DEF
Correct answer D,E,F

Selected Answer: DEF
As a previous question, I think the D, E, and F is correct.

Selected Answer: DEF
B is out of sorts, and doesn't have much to do with remaining answers to choose from, knowing that D and E need to be part of the solution

Selected Answer: DEF
D ,E & F is correct
Correct

questions.question_text:
A company currently using Dynamics AX 2009 plans to upgrade to Dynamics 365.
You need to recommend a data migration tool to transfer critical data.
Which two data migration tools should you recommend? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: should be A and C

comments.content:
disagree , AX2009 has DIXF too, check the link

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/migration-upgrade/ax2009-upgrade-export-package

I think answer is correct (C,D)

discussion.content: A, C is correct. DIXF is used for data migration from AX 2012.

You can use the Microsoft Dynamics AX 2009 Data migration tool (DMT) to migrate your data from AX 2009 to finance and operations. Using the DMT is the only supported upgrade path from AX 2009. The DMT helps you find and fill gaps between the table schemas for each version, as well as helping you move your data. So answer is A and C.

Selected Answer: AD
Both can be used for AX2009
Answer should be A & D

Selected Answer: AC
Should be A,C

Selected Answer: CD
AX2009 has DIXF too, check the link

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/migration-upgrade/ax2009-upgrade-export-package

I think answer is correct (C,D)

Selected Answer: AC
A and C

Selected Answer: AC
A and C
A and C are correct. Reference: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/migration-upgrade/ax2009-upgrade-import-package

choices.A: Microsoft Dynamics AX 2009 Data migration tool (DMT)

questions.question_text:
A company uses Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management and has two legal entities that distribute the same items. One of the legal entities uses advanced warehouse management.
New items that are created must meet the business needs of both companies and allow for consolidated analytics.
You need to recommend a master data management strategy to standardize the item master and meet the business requirements.
What should you recommend?

discussion.content: A because the item configurations are different for each legal entity.
CDM create a template is a traditional way to do.

Selected Answer: A
Common Data Management is not even a Dynamics term. Perhaps they refer to Common Data model but that's not the solution here.

Selected Answer: D
I think key is that they are speaking about "standarize item creation". To do that, you need to create templates in each company to reflect required setup, and use it when create new items.

Then, I think D is correct

Selected Answer: A
In my opinion A

Selected Answer: A
A, because products are global and released products are local with local setup.

Agreed. 
A is the correct answer. You create a product and release to both LE follow by maintaining Storage dimension (1 for WMS/ The other non -WMS).

choices.E: Create an item in each company with different item numbers.
choices.B: Use an advanced warehouse setup for the product and release to both companies.
choices.C: Create an item in each company with the same item number.
choices.A: Create the product record and release to each company where setup variations are completed.
choices.D: Use Common Data Management to create the item templates for both legal entities.
